solution.text:
Volume of the earth from the digging = volume of the well
volume of the well\(=\pi \times r^2 \times h\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac {22}7 \times _{{7*j}}_^2 \times _{{24*j*24}}_\)
Let the height of the platform be H
Volume of the platform \(=\pi \times H \times [outer\, radius^2 - inner\,radius^2]=\pi \times H \times (R^2 - r^2)\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac {22}7 \times H \times (_{{25*j}}_^2-_{{7*j}}_^2)\)
Now equating the volumes of platform and well we get
\(\Rightarrow \frac {22}7 \times _{{7*j}}_^2 \times _{{24*j*24}}_=\frac {22}7 \times H \times (_{{25*j}}_^2-_{{7*j}}_^2)\)
\(\Rightarrow H\)=\(_{{7*j}}_^2\times_{{24*j*24}}_ \over _{{25*j}}_^2 - _{{7*j}}_^2\)\(\Rightarrow \)\( _{{7*j}}_^2\times_{{24*j*24}}_ \over _{j}_^2(25^2 - 7^2)\)\(\Rightarrow \)\( _{{7*j}}_^2\times_{{24*j*24}}_ \over _{j}_^2(24^2)\)
\(\Rightarrow H = _{{49*j}}_cm\)

content.text:
A _{{24*j*24}}_ cm deep well with radius _{{7*j}}_ cm is dug
The earth from digging is evenly spread out to form a platform.
Outer radius of the platform is _{{25*j}}_cm and it's shape is shown in the figure.
Find the height of the platform.
